habitat_description:
Northwest:
Primary habitat of the mountain ecotype of the woodland caribou consists of old-growth (>100-150 years old) western red cedar, western hemlock, and Engelmann spruce/subalpine fir forests of the southern Selkirk Mts. above 4000 ft (1220m)(USFWS 2011). These forests typically contain high snowfall and arboreal hair lichens - essential as late winter food for this population of the subspecies (Kinley and Apps 2007, USFWS 2011).
